channel.title: News - South China Morning Post
channel.description: All the latest breaking news from Hong Kong, China and around the world

item.title: Global food inflation to worsen further as India weighs wheat export curbs
item.description: To safeguard domestic supplies amid a heatwave-fuelled shortage, the government is considering limiting wheat exports.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: What can commuters expect from cross-harbour section of Hong Kong’s most expensive rail project when it opens on May 15?
item.description: Travel times are expected to be shorter, with journeys between Tai Wai and Admiralty on East Rail line taking only 17 minutes without need to change lines.
item.dc:creator: Cannix Yau
item.author: Cannix Yau

item.title: Husband goes viral because he cooks for his wife, sparking debate about why it is considered special in China
item.description: The mainland Chinese internet is debating why a husband who cooks every day for his wife went viral despite women often doing the same.
item.dc:creator: Liya Su
item.author: Liya Su

item.title: Hong Kong’s base rate rises by 50 basis points, as the cost of money makes its biggest one-time jump in more than two decades after US Fed’s decision
item.description: The US economy had not seen a 50-basis point rate increase since Alan Greenspan was Fed chairman, and “irrational exuberance” was the catchphrase that defined the easy money and mood of the Dotcom era.
item.dc:creator: Enoch Yiu
item.author: Enoch Yiu

item.title: Coronavirus Hong Kong: residents ready to enjoy sun, sea and sports without masks as Covid-19 measures further ease
item.description: Social-distancing measures further relax in Hong Kong as coronavirus situation continues to abate.
item.dc:creator: Sammy Heung
item.author: Sammy Heung

item.title: Beijing will win over Hong Kong by listening to public opinion, not by silencing it
item.description: Post-handover, Beijing sought to understand, then win over, public opinion in Hong Kong; by 2005, a willingness to embrace Chinese identity had never been higher. Recently, however, there are signs that truth and fact are under siege with attacks by state-run media on legitimate sources of information.
item.dc:creator: David A. Rezvani
item.author: David A. Rezvani

item.title: Joe Biden’s Indo-Pacific strategy gets thumbs down by two Japanese legislators
item.description: Rather than introduce a new framework, US is urged to join Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership, the successor to the pact the US abandoned five years ago.
item.dc:creator: Robert Delaney
item.author: Robert Delaney

item.title: Joe Biden calls Donald Trump’s ‘MAGA crowd’ the ‘most extreme’ political group in US history
item.description: Faced with sky-high inflation and tough midterm elections for the Democrats, the US president wants to remind voters that Trump is lurking in the wings.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: China-US ties: Lloyd Austin looks forward to meeting Chinese defence minister Wei Fenghe to ‘engage in the future’
item.description: US Defence Secretary tells Senate Appropriations Committee said he hoped his engagement with China’s defence minister would be the first of many, with both sides keen to keep communication open.
item.dc:creator: Jack Lau
item.author: Jack Lau

item.title: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken tests positive for Covid-19 ahead of China policy speech
item.description: The top US diplomat is experiencing mild symptoms; President Biden, whom he has not seen in person for days, is not considered a close contact.
item.dc:creator: Joshua Cartwright
item.author: Joshua Cartwright

item.title: Donald Trump’s 2020 team poll-tested idea of expelling all Chinese scientists from US, new book says
item.description: In search of a hot campaign issue, aides explored ideas like letting Americans sue China in court, and sending the National Guard into cities amid social unrest, a new book says.
item.dc:creator: Business Insider
item.author: Business Insider

item.title: Why US sanctions on ‘state-controlled’ Chinese companies smack of hypocrisy
item.description: Washington’s targeting of Chinese enterprises it claims are controlled by Beijing has seen hundreds of companies banned on national security grounds. Yet the US often exerts significant influence over businesses to comply with its ‘requests’. And, in return, they receive billions in subsidies.
item.dc:creator: Zhengjun Zhang,Yanyan Li
item.author: Zhengjun Zhang,Yanyan Li

item.title: Sinn Fein eyes historic win in Northern Ireland election
item.description: Voters caught in an economic crunch could propel the group – long linked to the paramilitary Irish Republican Army – to a landmark victory on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Guinea to prosecute ousted president Alpha Conde for murder
item.description: Former leader Alpha Conde is among 27 ex-senior officials accused of assassination, torture, kidnapping and other crimes during his time in office.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Can Europe survive looming gas shortages as Russia halts supplies?
item.description: While Europe debates whether it can survive Russia halting gas supplies, less has been said about preparing for shortages. Higher prices will not be sufficient and rationing should be a last resort, so governments must come up with initiatives that draw popular support.
item.dc:creator: Karsten Neuhoff,Isabella M. Weber
item.author: Karsten Neuhoff,Isabella M. Weber

item.title: Russia violates Finland’s airspace as Helsinki mulls Nato bid
item.description: An ‘Mi-17 helicopter’ was involved in the incident, which took place less than a month after an incursion by a Russian army transport aircraft in April.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: What is the CPTPP and why is China eager to join?
item.description: China says its application to join the Pacific Rim trade pact is consistent with efforts to reform and open up the economy, but it is unclear whether the country can meet the deal’s high standards.
item.dc:creator: Kandy Wong
item.author: Kandy Wong

item.title: Claim China’s Covid-19 ‘success’ has ‘shattered the American myth’ stirs online debate
item.description: Shanghai-based academic Zhang Weiwei says the country’s much lower death rate shows the superiority of the Chinese governance model.
item.dc:creator: Mimi Lau
item.author: Mimi Lau

item.title: Sri Lanka crisis will last at least two more years, finance minister says
item.description: Sri Lanka faces its worst ever economic crisis in decades due to the lack of foreign reserves, resulting in severe shortages in food, fuel, medicine, and imported goods.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Cyberattack on Hong Kong news agency FactWire leads to unauthorised access of subscriber data
item.description: Agency says its website, internal system and newsletter delivery operations were attacked, but that information on donor list was not accessed.
item.dc:creator: Christy Leung
item.author: Christy Leung

item.title: Hong Kong press award winners left in limbo as American university says it will not get involved in this year’s event
item.description: Professor Jeffrey Timmermans says Arizona State University will take over Hong Kong press group’s event from 2023, ‘so we aren’t involved in this year’s awards’.
item.dc:creator: Chris Lau
item.author: Chris Lau

item.title: Hong Kong police consider importing pistols from mainland China to replace American revolvers
item.description: Source says force recently received dozens of Chinese-made pistols for officers to test, give feedback.
item.dc:creator: Clifford Lo
item.author: Clifford Lo

item.title: Ukraine war: Zelensky says no deal without Russian withdrawal, Putin must agree to meet to negotiate end of fighting
item.description: Ukrainian President said it was important to continue peace talks, but noted “until the Russian president signs it or makes an official statement I don’t see the point in such agreements.”
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Pope Francis, Japan’s Kishida discuss hopes for nuclear-free world after North Korea test launch, Ukraine war
item.description: Meeting came as nuclear-armed Russia pressed its war in Ukraine and after North Korea launched a ballistic missile toward its eastern waters and vowed to speed up the development of its own nuclear arsenal.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: The Grand Mayfair I project in Yuen Long enjoys strong sales as discounts attract first-time buyers
item.description: The project, developed by Sino Land, K Wah International and China Overseas Land and Investment, found buyers for 322 of the 327 flats on offer on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Lam Ka-sing
item.author: Lam Ka-sing

item.title: PLA Navy steps up real-life combat drills in East China Sea near Taiwan
item.description: Drills follow series of air and sea exercises in response to US lawmakers' visit to Taiwan in April.
item.dc:creator: Liu Zhen
item.author: Liu Zhen

item.title: Coronavirus: India and WHO at odds over New Delhi’s Covid-19 death totals
item.description: A soon to be released WHO report estimates India’s actual Covid-19 death toll is as high as 4 million, about eight times New Delhi’s official figure.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: Coronavirus: new Covid-19 variants emerge, likely reinfecting Omicron survivors
item.description: Current data do not suggest BA.4 and BA.5 cause people to get sicker than earlier Omicron variants, but BA.4 and BA.5 do appear to be more transmissible.
item.dc:creator: dpa
item.author: dpa

item.title: Hong Kong chief executive election 2022: anti-graft agency to deploy more than 80 officers to monitor leadership vote
item.description: Agency head Simon Peh says on-duty officers will be split between their headquarters in North Point and the polling venue in Wan Chai.
item.dc:creator: Christy Leung
item.author: Christy Leung

item.title: China coronavirus: mass-testing push could cost 1.7 trillion yuan a year if rolled out across country
item.description: As more cities announce mass-testing initiatives, analysts warn that the cost of such efforts will further pressure local authorities and municipal coffers that are already being strained by attempts to shore up economic growth.
item.dc:creator: Orange Wang
item.author: Orange Wang

item.title: Hong Kong chief executive election 2022: young protesters should be given opportunities to reintegrate into society, says candidate John Lee
item.description: John Lee also denies press freedom is under threat and warns that some people who claim to be working for media have political agendas.
item.dc:creator: Nadia Lam,Tony Cheung
item.author: Nadia Lam,Tony Cheung

item.title: Dave Chapelle tackled during a Netflix comedy show at the Hollywood Bowl
item.description: Security guards chased and overpowered the attacker, and Chappelle was able to continue his performance while the man was taken away in an ambulance.
item.dc:creator: Agencies
item.author: Agencies

item.title: EU proposes total ban on Russian oil imports as war in Ukraine grinds on
item.description: Commission President Ursula von der Leyen proposes staggered ban on imports, but some member states may be reluctant to support measure.
item.dc:creator: Finbarr Bermingham
item.author: Finbarr Bermingham

item.title: Elon Musk suggests charging some Twitter users, as platform trials non-public tweets for smaller ‘circles’
item.description: Elon Musk said Twitter will remain free for ‘casual users’ by a ‘slight’ fee could be imposed for commercial and government users to help grow the platform’s revenue which lags behind other social media networks.
item.dc:creator: Reuters,dpa
item.author: Reuters,dpa

item.title: Apple supplier Foxconn freezes hiring of new workers for world’s largest iPhone factory in Zhengzhou amid citywide lockdown
item.description: Foxconn has frozen its hiring of new assembly line workers for the world’s largest iPhone factory, as the central Chinese city of Zhengzhou went into lockdown for seven days.
item.dc:creator: Xinmei Shen
item.author: Xinmei Shen

item.title: Hong Kong man gets suspended jail sentence for inciting others to cast invalid votes in Legislative Council election
item.description: Products manager Victor Chou, 57, used Facebook to call for protest against new electoral regime by casting blank ballots in December 19 poll.
item.dc:creator: Brian Wong
item.author: Brian Wong

item.title: China’s yuan ‘far from a top global reserve’, as investors dump assets amid Ukraine war
item.description: Coronavirus lockdowns, yuan depreciation and the perceived risk of investing in countries whose relationships with the West are complicated explain China’s capital outflows, a new report says.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Lee
item.author: Amanda Lee

item.title: Hong Kong legislature passes HK$700 billion budget with tax breaks, raft of subsidies for coronavirus relief
item.description: Bill approved with 87 supporting votes and no objections, while social welfare sector representative Tik Chi-yuen voted to abstain.
item.dc:creator: Tony Cheung
item.author: Tony Cheung

item.title: Females of a spider species decide if mate is worthy by forcing it to catapult away after copulation or else she’ll eat him
item.description: Males from a species of spider that is common in China use a catapult mechanism to fling themselves away from the females after sex to avoid getting eaten.
item.dc:creator: Kevin McSpadden
item.author: Kevin McSpadden

item.title: Philippine election: Is Leni Robredo allied with ‘communist terrorists’? No, former military spokesman says
item.description: The presidential candidate – and current vice-president – has been falsely accused of aiding and abetting the Philippines’ long-running communist insurgency, an accusation that can have deadly consequences.
item.dc:creator: Raissa Robles
item.author: Raissa Robles

item.title: Ukraine war: Russia pounds Ukraine, targeting supply of Western arms
item.description: The flurry of attacks over the past day comes as Russia prepares to celebrate Victory Day on May 9, marking the Soviet Union’s defeat over Nazi Germany.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Mainland China university student admits he tried to kill 4 women in Hong Kong in the hope of getting death sentence
item.description: Liu Yueteng, 26, attacked four woman in Sham Shui Po in 2019, hoping to kill them so he could go back to mainland China and get the death penalty.
item.dc:creator: Brian Wong
item.author: Brian Wong

item.title: Vietnam coffee farmers turn to avocados and durians as Ukraine war pushes up fertiliser costs
item.description: An official said despite the extra income from these additional crops, growers are still having to cut back investment in their coffee trees.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: Chinese researchers set up world’s highest weather station on Mount Everest to study roof of the world
item.description: ‘Summit Mission’ project involves 5 scientific research teams, 16 scientific groups and more than 270 researchers.
item.dc:creator: Guo Rui
item.author: Guo Rui

item.title: Abortion-rights protesters rally in US cities after Supreme Court leak
item.description: Protests over a leaked US Supreme Court draft opinion that would throw out the court’s Roe vs Wade ruling sent people into the streets around the nation.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Coronavirus: Beijing doubles down on curbs to keep a lid on ‘still challenging’ outbreak
item.description: China’s capital confirms only 51 new Covid-19 infections, but officials point to sporadic cases as cause for concern.
item.dc:creator: Mia Castagnone
item.author: Mia Castagnone

item.title: Didi Global, China ride-hailing giant, reveals it faces an SEC probe about its NYSE IPO, on top of Beijing’s scrutiny and looming delisting
item.description: The Chinese ride-hailing giant revealed in its annual report filed on Tuesday that it faces a probe by the US stock-market watchdog concerning its US$4.4 billion initial public offering last summer. The revelation adds to woes including a cybersecurity investigation and potential NYSE delisting.
item.dc:creator: Zhou Xin
item.author: Zhou Xin

item.title: JD Vance notches victory for Donald Trump with Republican primary win in Ohio
item.description: Donald Trump’s chosen candidate, ‘Hillbilly Elegy’ author and one-time investment banker JD Vance, won the crowded Republican primary for US Senate in Ohio, giving Trump a strong beginning to primary season.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: Hong Kong student, 17, arrested over drug trafficking after customs seizes HK$4.3 million in narcotics stashed in imported dog food
item.description: Authorities found narcotics hidden in sacks of dog food from Spain, with the suspect believed to have pocketed HK$20,000 as reward to collect the goods.
item.dc:creator: Clifford Lo
item.author: Clifford Lo
